bestBHT.bht: Through our union with Christ, believers are spiritually quickened and raised up with Him in heavenly places. This close connection guarantees our future bodily resurrection and allows us to share in His honors and anticipate the glory that awaits us. In Christ, we already possess a blessed immortality and a foretaste of heavenly glory. Christ has prepared glorious mansions for us as our forerunner, and we currently sit in these heavenly places with Him and all the saints.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: The 'raising up' presupposes previous quickening of Jesus in the tomb, and of us in the grave of our sins.
Believers are bodily in heaven in point of right, and virtually so in spirit.
Our union with Him is the ground of our present spiritual, and future bodily, resurrection and ascension.
Albert Barnes: So close is the connection between him and his people, that his resurrection made theirs certain.
That is, we share his honors. So close is our connection with him, that we shall partake of his glory.

His entrance there is a pledge that we shall also enter there. Even here we have the anticipation of glory, and are admitted to exalted honors, as if we sat in heavenly places, in virtue of our connection with him.
Marvin Vincent: Even now we sit there in Him, and shall sit with Him in the end" (Andrews, cited by Ellicott).
Resurrection, enthronement, heaven, all are in Christ.
John Calvin: It is as if we had been brought from the deepest hell to heaven itself.
Although, as respects ourselves, our salvation is still the object of hope, yet in Christ we already possess a blessed immortality and glory.
Of everything which we now want, we have a sure pledge and foretaste in the person of Christ.
Philip Schaff: The reference, as in Ephesians 2:5, is physical and future, but at the same time spiritual and present.
In the heavenly places. This is to be explained as in chap. Ephesians 1:3; Ephesians 1:20.

In Christ Jesus. This does not qualify 'in the heavenly places,' but should be joined with the verbs. It brings out more fully than 'together,' the fact that all these saving acts are in virtue of our mystical union with Christ.
Archibald T. Robertson: In Christ Jesus (εν Χριστω Ιησου). All the preceding turns on this phrase."
Made to sit with him (συνεκαθισεν). First aorist active indicative of συνκαθιζω, old causative verb, but in N.T. only here and Luke 22:55.
John Gill: Both [spiritual and corporeal resurrection] bear the same name; both are a declaration of sonship; and both the first step to glory in Christ and in his people.
Christ is entered into heaven as the forerunner, to take possession of it for his people, in their name; and to prepare mansions of glory for them, and in these they sit.
And what adds to the happiness of this is, that it is together with all the saints, and with Christ himself; and in these they are made to sit already.
John Wesley: Both Jews and gentiles already in spirit; and ere long our bodies too will be raised.
Believers are not yet possessed of their seats in heaven; but each of them has a place prepared for him.
Each of them has a place prepared for him.

bhtAttempts.bht: Through our union with Christ, we are not only spiritually quickened but also raised up with Him in heavenly places. This connection is so intimate that His resurrection guarantees our future bodily resurrection. As believers, we share in His honors and anticipate the glory that awaits us. Though our salvation is still the object of hope, in Christ we already possess a blessed immortality and a foretaste of the heavenly glory. We have a sure pledge of everything we need through Him. As Christ entered heaven as the forerunner, He prepared glorious mansions for us, and together with Him and all the saints, we are already made to sit in these heavenly places. Our spiritual resurrection now precedes our future bodily resurrection, but both bear the same name and declare our sonship and future glory in Christ and in His people.

Through our union with Christ, believers are spiritually quickened and raised up with Him in heavenly places. This close connection ensures that His resurrection guarantees our future bodily resurrection. We share in His honors and anticipate the glory that awaits us. Although our salvation is still a hope, in Christ we possess a blessed immortality and a foretaste of heavenly glory. Christ, as our forerunner, has already prepared glorious mansions for us, and we currently sit in these heavenly places with Him and all the saints.

Through our union with Christ, believers are spiritually quickened and raised up with Him in heavenly places. This guarantees our future bodily resurrection and allows us to share in His honors and anticipate the glory that awaits us. In Christ, we already possess a blessed immortality and a foretaste of heavenly glory. As our forerunner, Christ has prepared glorious mansions for us and we currently sit in these heavenly places with Him and all the saints.

In Christ, we already possess a blessed immortality and a foretaste of heavenly glory. Christ has prepared glorious mansions for us as our forerunner, and we currently sit in these heavenly places with Him and all the saints.

Christ, as our forerunner, has prepared glorious mansions for us, and we currently sit in these heavenly places with Him and all the saints.
